link:labelLink.link:label: JISC General Ledger

Contains all of the journal entry details for each transaction (e.g. associated journal entry ID, associated account number, debits or credits associated with the journal entry line). This table should be at the journal entry line level.
Journal ID
Unique identifier for each journal entry.
Journal Number
Number of the journal entry.
Effective Date
Date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or created. This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date.
Journal Entry Header Description
Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.
JISC General Ledger
JISC General Ledger
JISC General Ledger
Bill Number

Number of the bill. A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrusts the drawee at sight. A specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities.
Bill Date
Date of the bill.
JISC General Ledger
JISC General Ledger
GL05b

Contains additional information about the sources provided in the GL Details table. Each source shall include a description of the ERP system or accounting package, from which the data is extracted, and information related to the business process the data represents.
Source Code
Code for the posting source (code for the source from which the journal entry originated).
Source Description
Description of the source system.
ERP Subledger Module

Description of the subledger or ERP module from which the journal entry originated. This should tie back to a system or significant accounting process. In some instances, it can be represented by the source system.
System Manual Identifier
Indicates whether the journal entry is system-generated or manually-entered.
Business Process Major
Major class of transaction associated with a business process.
Business Process Minor
Sub-process of a major business process.
BS02y

Contains information related to the accounting period, including corresponding fiscal year, beginning date and ending date. The table captures the time range within a specific reporting period and year, in which business transactions and entries are accumulated into financial statements and other reports.
Fiscal Year
Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.
Accounting Period
Accounting period in which the calendar date occurs.
Accounting Period Beginning Date
Calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.
Accounting Period Ending Date
Calendar ending date of the current accounting period.
BS18m

Contains information on methods used to settle transactions. Businesses can adopt various methods to settle transactions and transfer money, especially in sales and purchase activities. Typical settlement methods include cash settlements, issuing bills, using credit cards, bank remittances and bank collections.
Settlement Method Code
Code for the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money.
Settlement Method Name
Name of the settlement method.
Active Flag
Indicates whether the settlement method is active or inactive.
JISC02b
Consumption Tax Subtotal by Tax Category information.
Tax Local Amount
The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in local currency.
Tax Transaction Amount
The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.
Consumption Tax Subtotal
Tax Category
Duty or tax or fee category code
Tax Ratio
The tax rate for this category, expressed as a percentage.
Transaction Taxable Amount
The net amount to which the tax percent (rate) is applied to calculate the tax amount in transaction currency code.
Local Taxable Amount
The net amount to which the tax percent (rate) is applied to calculate the tax amount in local currency code.
JISC04b

Contains all of the journal entry line details for each transaction (e.g. associated journal entry ID, associated account number, debits or credits associated with the journal entry line). This table should be at the journal entry line level.
Journal Line ID
Unique identifier for each journal entry.
Journal Line Number
Number of the line within a journal entry.
Journal Entry Line Description
Description of the individual line within the journal entry.
Quantity
Quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line. When the GL Account Number is for inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective. If not, this field is NULL.
Unit Price
Per unit price of the inventory or PPE. This field is associated with Quantity and Amount.
Credit Debit Indicator
Indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit.
Reversal Indicator
Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed.
Reversal Journal ID
When the Reversal Indicator = 1, this field identifies the Journal ID of the entry being reversed.
Cancellation Sign
Sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted.
JISC20b
Pertains to Ledger Account data, with the exclusion of Business Segment information.
General Ledger Account Number
Number of the GL account.
General Ledger Account Name
Name of the GL account.
General Ledger Account Description
Label or description associated with the GL Account Number.
Financial Statement Caption
Financial statement caption that represents a related group of accounts. , AP, cost of sales. The caption can be at the trial balance level.
Account Type
Type of account.
Account Subtype
Subtype of the account.
Account Hierarchy
Corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy.
Balance Debit Or Credit Code

Indicates whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating D or C, where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.
CC04w
Class for monetary amounts in multi currency .
Functional Amount
A monetary amount in functional currency
Reporting Amount
A monetary amount in reporting currency
Local Amount
A monetary amount in local currency
Transaction Amount
A monetary amount in transaction currency
CC10B
Class for the user activities including creation, approval, and last modification.
CC06B
Information about the data that was created into the system.
Created
Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Time
The time of activity.
CC07B
Information about the data was approved within the system.
Approved
Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Time
The time of activity.
CC08B
Information about the data was last modified within the system.
Last Modified
Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Time
The time of activity.
CC09e
Information about the data that was posted.
Posted
Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Time
The time of activity.
GL01d

Contains the code and name for the account segment, as well as the GL Account Number to which the account segment is related. Account Segment provides additional information for particular GL Accounts. Such information would be treated as an Account Segment below A/R, thus resulting in a lengthy account structure. The Account Segment structure is therefore defined as a set to record related information, which efficiently stops account names and numbers from becoming too long and too complex. Account Segment is more flexible to capture the complicated information. Some of the most frequently used account segments are defined as fixed fields in tables, such as GL Details. These segments are called "fixed account segments" in the document. Fixed account segments and other customized account segments are covered in this table.
General Ledger Account Segment ID
General Ledger Account Number
Number of the GL account.
Account Segment Number

Number of the Account Segment. Case 1: If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by the Account Segment Name of the record. Case 2: If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account Segment X, named Account Segment 5 in the tables, such as GL Details.
Account Segment Name

Name of the Account Segment. Case 1: If the value of the Account Segment Number of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as Account Segment Employee. Case 2: If the value of the Account Segment Number of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, such as welfare expenditure.
Corresponding File

Table corresponding to the account segment. Case 1: If the value of the Account Segment Number of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS Employee for Account Segment Employee. Case 2: If the value of the Account Segment Number is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS Customized ACC Segment contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS Customized ACC Segment. Case 3: If the value of the Account Segment Number is larger than 0, and there is a table containing the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the table's name, such as BAS Customer.
Account Segment Description
Detailed description of the Account Segment Name.
General Ledger Account Segment
BS10e

An Account Segment is a customized file item, which includes the information of the customized account segments that are not fixed account segments and no other table contains their description information. This table is used together with the BAS Customized ACC Value.
Customized Account Segment ID
Customized Account Segment Code
Code for the customized account segment that audit data need to be used. This does not include the fixed account segment having been identified.
Customized Account Segment Name
Customized account segment name that audit data need to be used.
Customized Account Description
Customized account segment description that audit data need to be used.
Customized Account Encoding Rule
Encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment. If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by "-".
Hierarchy Flag
Whether or not the table value has a hierarchy feature.
Active Flag
Indicates whether the Customized ACC Segment Code is active or inactive.
Parent
BS05bC

The BAS Business Segment and the BAS Business Segment Hierarchy have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project). The fields within the BAS Business Segment are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram.
Business Segment Code
Code for each business segment.
Business Segment Name
Name of the business segment.
Segment Reference Level
Relative level of the segment, with 1 being the consolidated level and the numbers increasing through the lower levels of the organizational chart.
Organization Type Name
Indicates the name of the organization type.
JISC02c
Consumption Tax Subtotal by Tax Category information.
Tax Local Amount
The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in local currency.
Tax Transaction Amount
The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.
Consumption Tax Subtotal
Tax Category
Duty or tax or fee category code
Tax Ratio
The tax rate for this category, expressed as a percentage.
Transaction Taxable Amount
The net amount to which the tax percent (rate) is applied to calculate the tax amount in transaction currency code.
Local Taxable Amount
The net amount to which the tax percent (rate) is applied to calculate the tax amount in local currency code.
